text:
Hi my name is Pedram Mokrian. I'm an Adjunct 
Professor here at Stanford School of Engineering.

This course is designed for people that are 
looking to get a better perspective on what

exactly AI is about and demystify some of these 
notions in terms of what is machine learning,

how is it different from AI, what are some of 
the applications, where is the future going.

We're going to begin with taking a historical 
view of AI, a very high level view of the

technologies, how are we actually applying this AI 
infrastructure and advancements in the technology

that we're getting into business outcomes. We're 
going to try to bring this all together by giving

you an idea of how to think more strategically 
about how do you actually put in place an AI

strategy as part of an existing product or 
actually creating an entirely new product

line or service line that's centered around AI. 
Joining me are going to be a myriad of folks

that are coming from industry themselves with a 
depth of background and artificial intelligence

that is world-class. You have large amounts 
of data that these machines will be able to,

given our guidance, run through very quickly 
find the patterns, find the signals, and start to

create potentially either better products for you 
or new products for you. And that's really what's

driving almost all of the the data-driven business 
strategies now is is going out and getting data

rather than commodity analytics. 
We've built a lot of infrastructure,

whether by technology or by policy, in 
order to manage just the data aspect of it

before we even start looking at it from an AI 
algorithm what can we learn from a perspective.

So we're really really excited to be able 
to share some of these insights with you
and we're excited to get this course underway.
